title: Extend CRM Functionality in 3 Steps
subtitle: Using intelligent follow-up reminders as an example, experience how to implement feature extensions with no-code.

steps.title: Extend Data Model
steps.description: All functionality starts with data. First, let's enter the "Leads" collection to add new capabilities to it.

button.label: All functionality starts with data. First, let's enter the "Leads" collection to add new capabilities to it.

steps.title: Step 1: Extension - Add New Fields & Interactions to CRM
steps.description: The birth of functionality begins with extending data models and user interfaces. Let's start by adding necessary capabilities and operation entries to the CRM.

steps.title: Add "Reminder" Related Fields
steps.description: To implement reminders, we first need a place to store reminder information. Let's add two key fields to the leads collection: "Reminder Time" and "Reminder Notes".

steps.title: Create "Set Reminder" Button
steps.description: With data ready, now let's create an operation entry for users. We'll add a button on the details page to open a reminder setting popup.

steps.title: Design Reminder Popup
steps.description: Carefully design the popup's title, button text, and style to make the interaction experience clearer and more user-friendly.

steps.title: Embed Form in Popup
steps.description: Drag the "Reminder Time" and "Reminder Notes" fields we created in the first step into the popup to form a complete data entry form.

steps.title: Display Reminder Info on Details Page
steps.description: For easy viewing of set reminders, let's also display these two fields directly at the bottom of the lead details page.

button.label: Display Reminder Info on Details Page

steps.title: Step 2: Automation - Create Workflow Connections
steps.description: Now, let's start building the backend automation processing logic, which is key to making the new functionality "come alive".

steps.title: Create Message Channel
steps.description: Automation processes need an outlet to send messages. Let's first create a dedicated "Lead Notifications" channel.

steps.title: Create Scheduled Workflow
steps.description: Start building the core logic: create a workflow named "Send Notification" and set its trigger to "Scheduled Task" to run automatically at specific times.

steps.title: Set Workflow Trigger Timing
steps.description: Configure the workflow's starting point: let it execute based on the "Reminder Time" field in the "Leads" collection. When system time reaches the reminder time, the workflow will start for that lead.

steps.title: Design Dynamic Notification Content
steps.description: Add a notification node, select the just-created channel, and carefully craft the notification content. You can use variables to dynamically insert lead name, notes, and other information.

steps.title: Configure Notification Jump Link
steps.description: To make notifications more practical, let's configure a clickable link. First copy the details page URL as a template, then replace the ID at the end with the "Trigger Data ID" variable, so each notification can precisely link to the correct lead.

steps.title: Enable Workflow
steps.description: Everything is ready, click "Enable" to make our automation rules officially take effect!

steps.title: Step 3: Validation - Test New Automation Features
steps.description: Finally, let's connect the frontend interface with backend logic and perform a complete end-to-end test to ensure everything works as expected.

steps.title: Link Frontend Button to Workflow
steps.description: Connect frontend and backend: return to the reminder popup configuration and bind its "Submit" button action to the "Send Notification" workflow we just created.

steps.title: Live Test: Create a Reminder
steps.description: Now, let's operate from the user's perspective. Open a lead and use the popup we created to set a reminder for a few minutes later.

steps.title: Receive Scheduled Reminder
steps.description: At the set time, the system automatically executed the workflow. Look, an accurate notification has been sent to our message center!

steps.title: Verify Jump Link
steps.description: Click the "View" button in the notification to verify if our configured dynamic link works. The page successfully jumps to the corresponding lead details page - the entire automation process forms a perfect loop!
